Package external_sort

Class ExternalSort<T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • external_sort.ExternalSort<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the elements
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Iterator<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OptimizedExternalSort
    public abstract class ExternalSort<T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Iterator<T>
    An ExternalSort sorts data elements in ascending order according to the natural ordering of the elements. An ExternalSort can also be used as an Iterator over all of these sorted data elements.
    Author:
    Jeong-Hyon Hwang (jhh@cs.albany.edu)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExternalSort

        public ExternalSort​(java.util.Iterator<T> iterator,
                    int degree,
                    int bufferSize,
                    java.lang.String fileNamePrefix,
                    java.io.PrintStream out)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Constructs an ExternalSort
        Parameters:
        iterator - the input Iterator
        degree - the number of runs that are merged together to form a new run
        bufferSize - the buffer size
        fileNamePrefix - the prefix that all of the run names (i.e., the names of the run files) will commonly have
        out - a PrintStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the class of a serialized object cannot be found
